instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3023: What is 820-3023? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.SMC_TPAD_RST_L: What is SMC_TPAD_RST_L? SMC_TPAD_RST_L is a signal that comes from the trackpad that can reset the SMC when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v. The trackpad having corrosion from liquid damage is a very common cause of no light on the magsafe charger & the system not turning on, when the trackpad or trackpad cable is corroded and holding this line down. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard / Track Pad Issue
threads.message:
Hello,

I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Air with a keyboard / track pad issue. I found corrosion on the trackpad connector which I replaced and trackpad started working as well as most of the keyboard keys. I replaced the whole keyboard and now both the trackpad and keyboard works. After a day of testing, both keyboard and trackpad suddenly stopped working. I checked voltages and was getting weird USB _TPAD_CONN_P / <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> voltages (2.8 volts / 1.9 volts). I replaced <CHIP>U5700</CHIP> and now I get 3.3 volts / 0 volts and trackpad / keyboard works again. However after 1 day of testing again, it stopped out of no where USB _TPAD_CONN_P / <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> abnormal voltages again. After a bunch of measuring, seems the only thing left is the <CHIP>U2650</CHIP> which I replaced. Worked for a little bit, and again back to weird issue. I replaced trackpad to make sure that might not be it and UC'd the board. Same issue. I even tried with the keyboard disconnected and just the track pad, but seems to have nothing to do with the newly installed keyboard.

Any thoughts?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard / Track Pad Issue
threads.message:
Check if both USB ports are working.

Do you get correct voltage at pins 1, 10, 13 of J5700.
Also check pin 12 level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard / Track Pad Issue
threads.message:
Hello, both USB ports are working.


14. <SIGNAL>SMC_TPAD_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3.42
13. <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42
12. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.42
11. <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 3.42
10. <SIGNAL>PP5V_TPAG_FILT</SIGNAL> 5
9. <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_MGMT_SCLK</SIGNAL> 3.3
8. <SIGNAL>SMBUS_SMC_MGMT_SD</SIGNAL> 3.3
7. GND
6. <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_N</SIGNAL> 2 (this is when it stops working)
5. <SIGNAL>USB_TPAD_CONN_P</SIGNAL> 2.8 (this is when it stops working)
4. GND
3. GND
2. <SIGNAL>SMC_PME_S4_WAKE_L</SIGNAL> 3
1. <SIGNAL>PP3V3_TPAD_CONN</SIGNAL> 3.3

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3023</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Keyboard / Track Pad Issue
threads.message: Check pin 5 & 6 disconnecting trackpad flex; voltage and diode mode to ground.
